programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: A fast turnaround order forces Dwayne and his team to deliver twice as quickly as usual. Despite the divers' relentless work ethic, they are met with a huge surprise back at port.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A truck transporting a vital cargo of pharmaceuticals plunges down a bank, a trailer splits open just before the morning rush, and Colin struggles to cope running the shop alone.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike need to make a perfect purchase to justify their long journey - and an embalming table with a fascinating history might be what they are looking for.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: The eight survivalists continue to settle into their new wilderness homes. On day four of the challenge, the men are beginning to discover the effects of extreme isolation.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: One of the contestants falls ill and begins to question his grip on reality, and keen to reap the rewards of a salmon river, another survivalist puts his life at risk.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer brings Rick an arm wrestling game from the 1950s in need of repair.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The guys restore a miniature car they found in a junkyard, while a fireman brings in a vintage 1930s forest field service phone.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Startling evidence suggesting that the Ancient Maya conspired with aliens, as experts hypothesise that they acquired extraterrestrial knowledge of astrology.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the Maya calendar, which predicted the world would end in 2012, and try to determine whether it could have anticipated the arrival of an extraterrestrial god.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright's challenge is to capture a dangerous crocodile that has been creeping worryingly close to humans and cattle, but relocating the 16ft killer by helicopter will not be an easy task.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists ask whether a currently unidentified species represented in human DNA could be a result of breeding between man and alien in the distant past.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The story of Travis Walton, who claims that in 1975 he was taken aboard a space ship inhabited by extraterrestrial beings. Plus, an analysis of the the Hebrew Bible, which is filled with stories of abductions by otherworldly beings.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists explore world mythology as they investigate whether extraterrestrials could be responsible for mankind's existence, having visited from other planets with Earth-like characteristics.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The theory that aliens might have told Joan of Arc how to beat the English army, and whether an American serviceman received a message when he touched a spaceship.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and a pawnbroker toss a coin for a box of collectable scout badges.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Almost the Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Dave puts a bid in for a unit of motor parts, much to the surprise of the buyers, who thought he was broke.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod take an interest in a furniture locker in Upland, California. Dave bids for a locker full of jewellery, but it remains to be seen if the contents are real.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds what could be a valuable antique gun - or possibly a worthless fake. Jarrod and Brandi get their hands on a collection of Depression-era art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod comes under pressure as his shop runs empty, while Barry tries to bring his losing streak to an end.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss's judgement is called into question and Darrell lays his hands on a timeless unit in Azusa. Jarrod insists it is quality that matters, not quantity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave returns to the fray, having run out of stock after missing several auctions. Barry comes up with a new strategy, and Darrell gets lost on his way to a sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: A fast turnaround order forces Dwayne and his team to deliver twice as quickly as usual. Despite the divers' relentless work ethic, they are met with a huge surprise back at port.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must craft a hatchet from pieces of odd-shaped steel. After several forging failures, parameter mishaps and intense conditions, only two head back to their home forges, where they must re-create the deadly Maasai lion spear.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Brothers Marty and Rick Lagina and the team find groundbreaking new evidence at Smith's Cove that connects the Oak Island mystery to the American Revolution.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's first flight to the homestead hits a wall of bad weather. Tom runs a gauntlet of timber in search of some late-season fur.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Hays and Bigfoot's hands are forced when the Empresario enlists them to protect the town from a Comanche attack. Elsewhere, Emily arouses Santa Anna's suspicions.

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with alcoholism is hired as a bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City - but when the girl is abducted, he swears to exact an explosive revenge on the kidnappers. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade, Sindhu Vee, Ed Gamble and Chloe Petts are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: You Use a Spoon for Licking Custard
programme.desc: Dave asks what the term generation really means, whether life hacks are any use and why his mum uses emojis.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A Close Slave, read by Dara O Briain. A Roman slave helps his playwright master finish his latest opus - but at what cost?.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A writer fabricates an elderly relative to get time off work to start his novel - but his lie comes to life. Told by Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer spins this dark, witty yarn about a jobbing actor who makes a smash-hit advert for tea in a former Soviet state.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Josh and his documentary team are in the wake of Typhoon Cimaron in Japan, as Hurricane Lane explodes onto the scene, barrelling towards Hawaii and threatening historic landfall.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, revealing what makes its officers tick, how they deal with the tragedies they inevitably have to face and how much they rely on each other and also their camaraderie.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers are called upon to restrain a man having a bad reaction to the 'zombie' drug Black Mamba. Cutting-edge documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: DEA agents in St Louis tackle a growing heroin epidemic, one dealer at a time. And St Louis law enforcement pulls out every stop to reverse the city's culture of drugs.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: St Louis DEA expands its investigation into a suspected heroin dealer who has so far dodged them at every turn, and young addicts attempt to break their addiction.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank finally get access to their white whale pick, while in Texas, the guys meet a collector who has filled an entire town with his mammoth stockpile.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford, chart star Paloma Faith and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Deborah Meaden compete to have their pet hates banished on the panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include people who use the phrase 'all due respect', smart-casual dress, jobsworths, people in lifts and Fifty Shades of Grey.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Singer Cilla Black, Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis and The Great British Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc compete to have their pet hates banished by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include dream bores, giant charity cheques, Las Vegas, knickers and people who make others sign cards.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Writer-presenter Clive Anderson, The One Show host Alex Jones and actor-comedian Jack Whitehall compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include British-themed bars in foreign countries, shared tables, deer, seagulls and metrosexuality.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A Cuban woman crosses the bridge in the hope of being granted political asylum in America, while officers in Laredo stop three students carrying something unusual in their car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Emma Barnett and stand-up Tom Allen joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Jimmy Carr, Gyles Brandreth and Sally Phillips, who answer questions on the subject of piecemeal, with points awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Katherine Ryan, Rich Hall
programme.desc: An evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Jack Whitehall is the man in charge, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by Canadian comedienne Katherine Ryan and American jokester Rich Hall.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Maritime engineering in recent years has seen ever bigger ships and sea-based platforms constructed. On occasion, they may need moving, which is the purpose of the Boka Vanguard, the planet's largest heavy lift ship, capable of sinking itself, floating under its cargo and then lifting it up to be moved anywhere on the planet with sea. This extraordinary work of engineering is capable of carrying the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty at the same time.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock
programme.desc: Scientists investigate a 1962 breakout from the island prison, to determine whether the escapees drowned while fleeing in a makeshift raft or if they safely made it to the mainland.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The old poem about the boy standing on the burning deck takes on new meaning as Kavanagh defends two Navy officers accused of arson, and finds he cannot use his only defence. It is a tough case, and the last thing he needs is extra stress at home - but that does not stop the children planning an anniversary party without telling him. With Andy Serkis, Ray Winstone and Geraldine James.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The monks cause a storm of resentment by launching an expedition to a Welsh village to recover the bones of St Winifred and return them to the abbey. As if that does not make them unpopular enough, a local landowner dies in mysterious circumstances and it is up to Brother Cadfael to clear his colleagues of murder and ensure they get out of the country alive. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Michael Culver, John Hallam and Anna Friel.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: The Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lovejoy sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible for deceiving his American acquaintance - and make a little money for himself into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Life at Tannochbrae faces a period of confusion as Janet completes her wedding plans and Dr Finlay investigates a suspicious death. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. The siege at the hospital takes a turn for the worse as Jack and Neil are taken hostage at gunpoint after an abortive attempt to free Roger. New DC Jo Masters takes charge of the delicate negotiations, while Steve realises only he can save Honey. Elsewhere, Samantha is appalled to learn Abi is carrying Hugh Wallis's baby and Terry begins to doubt whether his brother is guilty of the child abuse charges.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha begins to feel she's trapped in a never-ending nightmare when a confrontation with Abi leads to yet another revelation - she intends to marry her erstwhile kidnapper Hugh. Turning to Phil for help, Samantha hatches a plan to snatch her pregnant, brainwashed daughter from the psychopath's clutches - but it seems she may have underestimated the extent of his cunning. Community Support Officers Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Dale, and Honey oversteps the line when she attempts to console a distraught husband whose wife has gone missing.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam struggles to prove that Hugh Wallis abducted, brainwashed and raped her daughter, but the suspect arrogantly sticks to his story that Abi instigated the sexual relationship that has left her pregnant and emotionally wrecked. DCs Jo Masters and Suzie Sim investigate a case involving rent boys and pornography which implicates DI Neil Manson's father-in-law, a Deputy Assistant Commissioner at Scotland Yard and, undaunted by the risk of making enemies in high places, Jack Meadows organises a raid on the officer's home. Honey Harman confesses her unprofessional behaviour to Steve Hunter, but her next anguished encounter with Scott Burnett leads to another tender embrace. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The die-hard dame of the Wainthropp Detective Agency sets about flushing out a missing company director who is sought by his creditors. Back at home, Hetty's interfering brother-in-law Frank has come to stay and Robert has flown off to Australia to visit their son Derek.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: Bafta award-winning writer Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel, first published in 1815. Romola Garai stars as the independent Emma Woodhouse, who believes she is a skilled matchmaker and tries to pair up her friends and acquaintances. She takes Harriet Smith under her wing and encourages the woman to set her sights higher than her current suitor - against Mr Knightley's warnings about the dangers of meddling. With Jonny Lee Miller, Michael Gambon, Jodhi May and Tamsin Greig.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: While continuing her efforts to set up Harriet and the vicar, Emma looks forward to meeting Frank Churchill at the Christmas party, but when he fails to show up she becomes the subject of Mr Elton's unwanted attention. Later, village gossip focuses on the arrival of Jane Fairfax and a piano she was given by a mystery admirer, leaving the matchmaker reluctant to believe Mr Knightley could have sent the gift. Drama, starring Romola Garai, Louise Dylan, Blake Ritson and Laura Pyper.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The heroine plans a ball with Frank, and wonders whether she has feelings for him. Despite having a wonderful time at the event, she still feels trapped, and with the matchmaking effort officially abandoned, becomes increasingly bored. However, her spirits are raised by Mr Knightley's proposal for a group outing to Box Hill, where he tells her he thinks Frank and Jane are in love. Drama, starring Romola Garai and Michael Gambon.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The outing to Box Hill ends in disaster when Emma insults Miss Bates. After being berated by Knightley, she realises her behaviour was shameful and tries to make amends, but Jane refuses to speak to her. When Frank's overbearing aunt dies, the Westons expect him to propose to Emma, but his subsequent actions start a chain of events that shocks the heroine, resulting in the realisation of a truth she previously dismissed. Romola Garai and Jonny Lee Miller star in the final instalment of Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Drama about military police and their families faced with political and personal conflicts in a 1960s British colony on the Red Sea coast. An officer and his wife arrive in Aden, where he is to replace a much-loved captain. He soon has to adjust to life on the frontline, along with resentment among the men that he was appointed instead of the already-present Lt Ed Laithwaite. Honor is taken under the wing of Laithwaite's wife, Alison, who had been having an affair with Captain Page. Starring Jessie Buckley and Jeremy Neumark Jones.

programme.title: Rocky Balboa (2006)
programme.desc: The ageing fighter contemplates a return to the ring when a computer simulation reveals he would have defeated the current world heavyweight champion Mason 'The Line' Dixon, who responds by challenging Rocky to face him for real. Boxing drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Antonio Tarver, Geraldine Hughes, Burt Young, Milo Ventimiglia and Tony Burton.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith accompanies DJ Nick Grimshaw on his weekly food shop and helps comedian Katherine Ryan buy a few things for her new house, while also chatting about their life and career.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school to welcome German Shepherd cross Declan and domesticated ferret Biscuit, to see if they can learn to ring a dinner bell to get their owners' attention. The star pet is Chaska, a world-class attack dog that really gets its teeth into the show's host. Plus, the trainers hit the road to train a miniature horse how to be a bellhop in a five-star hotel.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Virgil and Gordon must rescue a trapped urban-explorer in a trash mine, while Brains attempts a risky mission. Guest starring Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A lovely village mouse is stopped from her big stage debut, by the Phan-Tom of the Opera. Luckily Jerry is there to save the day.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ballad of the Catnip Kid: Tom dreams that he is in a big western showdown with Sheriff Jerry, in a musical episode.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is charged with keeping an eye on Irma's dog Mopsy, but Mopsy is a very wilful pooch! Who is really in charge of who?.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: The students decide to leave Po and escape back to Panda Village and prepare for the fight of their lives..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Barbados, where he prepares roasted breadfruit, salt fish and lobster, and pineapple French toast with caramelised bananas. He also visits a gully famed for lush vegetation, grapefruits and green monkeys, and catches up with an old friend who runs a beachside snack shop out of a converted bus.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic shepherd's pie, a simple recipe for fudgy chocolate cookies, sushi with two different fillings and a bakewell tart. Their guest is chef and baker Sal Dhalla, who cooks her roasted vegetable farinata.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches the island of Chios, where her family's story began. She's joined by her mother Chrissi and together they explore the home of their ancestors. In search of the fascinating history of Mastica, a natural resin only found on Chios, they visit a farm to discover how this mystical and miraculous tree sap has been harvested for thousands of years. After following in the footsteps of legendary Greek poet Homer, who is reputed to have been born on the island, their trip comes to an emotional end when they track down the house where Julia's great-grandparents once lived.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: All hands are on deck as the metro system prepares for the busiest day of the year - the Great North Run. This year, a new and untested station in South Shields is at the centre of things. One of the event's regular runners prepares for a personal return to the course, as he runs in tribute to a friend.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest. Only three of the show's famous contestants have kept their identity a secret, and tonight, these three finalists will be competing for the series trophy before all of them are unmasked. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong will have one last chance to guess the famous faces hidden behind the bizarre costumes, before all 12 of the show's performers take to the stage together for a special group performance.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: The Chase: I'm a Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as 2018 I'm a Celebrity campmates Rita Simons, Malique Thompson-Dwyer, Fleur East and James McVey try to win as much money as they dare before teaming up in the final round against one of the show's five quiz experts. But which Chaser will they be facing tonight?.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the ice once more, hoping they can do enough to impress judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman and avoid a place in the bottom two. Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present the action, including a musical interlude from the Script, accompanying a routine by the professional skaters.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As campaigning for the 1970 general election gets under way in Oxford, racial tensions escalate in the city and a clash between two rival gangs leads Morse and Thursday to the door of a familiar face, where they discover the influence of a right wing organisation hoping to win an Oxford seat. Things get worse at an Indian restaurant, where a mysterious disappearance and a shocking murder put even the strongest family loyalties to the test. Crime drama, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: On the final leg of their journey, the pair continue through the snow to New Hampshire. Here, they meet rally-driving champion Tim O'Neil who gives them a crash course in driving in the ice and snow before they take on an intense time trial. The pair travel on to Maine, where they take part in some wilderness training, before bidding farewell to the RV and heading out into the extremely choppy seas for some lobster fishing. Before heading home, the pair look back on some of their favourite moments from the trip.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp talks about his life and career as one of the most respected and experienced football managers in the modern game, as well as his victorious I'm a Celebrity appearance in 2018, when he was crowned King of the Jungle. He discusses the many twists and turns of his rollercoaster life, including a road accident in 1990 in which his friend Brian Tiler died. Harry also opens up about a dramatic dawn raid on his house and the death threats he received when he became manager of Southampton.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the London airport returns for a fifth season. Inside the terminal, seasoned pro Demi dishes out deals for delayed passengers, while outside on the airfield, Ian is on the runway as it goes into lockdown with a full armed police presence. For the first time this series, viewers will also see the work of the Border Force's canine drugs detection team - Rachel and her dog Cole, who in his career has intercepted more than 1million worth of class-A contraband. Narrated by Julie Walters.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce travels from Plymouth to Illinois by buying and selling various German hardware, while his mate Kevin purchases the last remaining German torpedo boat for five million pounds.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini starts off the auction season in Amelia Island where he shows a rare Renault Jolly and helps to sell a 1988 Porsche 959 Sport.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. The gang teams up with Nascar's Kyle Petty to construct a bike for auction to benefit the Victory Junction Gang Camp, which caters for children with special needs.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Brad wants his father's 1967 Mustang Coupe to be new again, so Dan has to fight 50 years of age and the way the car was initially built by the factory.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang hits the UK's biggest car show in Birmingham to showcase six of their favourite builds to the public. Plus, a review of the past year at the Garage.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How corn tortillas, Bush planes and aluminium bike wheels are manufactured.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Folding Kayaks/Refuse-collection Trucks/Ceramic Composite Brake Discs
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes used in producing folding kayaks, refuse-collection trucks and ceramic composite brake discs.

programme.title: Formula E
programme.desc: Highlights from the fourth-round race in Mexico City, Mexico.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang hits the UK's biggest car show in Birmingham to showcase six of their favourite builds to the public. Plus, a review of the past year at the Garage.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a charismatic classic - the Citroen HY Van. However, mechanic Edd China is concerned it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Bristol City and West Bromwich Albion v Nottingham Forest.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Action from the semi-finals in Cardiff.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day seven at Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring the opening session of the final.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. A typhoon puts livelihoods on the line, with rookie skipper Josh Harris's weaknesses exposed and Captain Sig's control of the Northwestern in jeopardy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer buys a micro car, the iconic Messerschmitt KR200 three-wheeler - but it costs him big money. Edd China is challenged to revive it so it can sell for mega money.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day seven at Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring the second session of the final.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team investigates a secret U-Boat docking station that could have aided Hitler's escape from Europe, and discover a sunken sub near Caleta de Loros.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot choose between two dresses she thinks are perfect - while another customer has tried on 50 gowns and thinks none of them are right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride returns to the shop for her first fitting, and a customer disagrees with her mother about the style of her dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown tends to Honey the dog, who has jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat. Plus, Tasmanian devils fight a mysterious illness, and a koala losing its sight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Steven and Justin's Story - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. After a year on a weight loss programme, Steven is non-compliant, and Justin focuses on a new career instead of his diet.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the story of Brittani, who had lost over 400lbs. Was she and Bill able to expand their family? Plus, after leaving her husband, Lupe is finally ready to make changes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Michael and Chris have different visions for their wedding and tension soon rises between the pair as Lori tries to find some common ground.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Heather's fiance acts like a drill sergeant when picking out dresses and the bride soon becomes frustrated with his bad attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman's brash mother causes her bridesmaids to feel self-conscious in their dresses, giving consultant Nikky a lot of work to do.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Cassie tries to build bridges between her two best friends, who have hated each other since the day they met.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Amber and Ajeshia struggle to reach a compromise on the necklines of their bridesmaid dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop, while another customer seeks to combine the styles of Audrey Hepburn and Joan Jett.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Designer Henry Roth wants to provide a customer with a perfect gown, while another bride brings her wedding planner to her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.sub-title: You Can't Always Get What You Want
programme.desc: A former cheerleader comes shopping with a boisterous entourage, and a customer tries on her dress for the first time since choosing it five months previously.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt struggles to navigate the Christmas crowds - will he get his shopping done? Plus, besotted Jeremy ignores his family to spend time with his girlfriend.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: As the new year arrives, Matt plans a renovation on the house, including a miniature kitchen for his wife Amy.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a young foal with a dislocated knee, after which every second counts as the team executes a seizure warrant and rushes it back.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated mare is rescued, and animal protection officers seize two Great Danes that were left home alone.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do meet 42-year-old Terri King, a terminally ill woman desperate to find her mother Joy, who thought adoption was her daughter's only chance of a decent life. At the time of Terri's birth, Joy was just 16 and homeless, but 18 months later she made the decision to leave her child at the Royal Children's Hospital. Despite years of searching Terri has found no trace of her. Plus, 46-year-old Nicole Engel seeks the nephew she hasn't seen for almost 20 years.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Ben Butler, who killed his young daughter Ellie while in a rage. Along with his wife, former EastEnders actress Jennie Gray, he faked the detailed he passed in an emergency services call and later protested innocence.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive..
